title: The 5th Paris Peace Forum opens with the participation of Minister Lamamra
text: The 5th Paris Peace Forum kicked off Friday in the French capital with the participation of Minister of Foreign Affairs and National Community Abroad in his capacity as representative of President of the Republic Abdelmadjid Tebboune.

In the opening session of this high-level edition, held under the theme “Ridding out the Multicrisis,” the participants examined the main current international challenges at the political, security, economic, energy and environmental levels, as well as ways to address them collectively and effectively.

On this occasion, Lamamra held bilateral talks with his counterparts of the Netherlands, Senegal, Rwanda, Norway, Croatia and Palestine, as well as the President of the Republic of Liberia, M. George Weah.

In addition to bilateral relations between Algeria and these countries, the talks focused on regional and international issues, in particular the war in Ukraine and the resulting strong polarization which threatens international peace and security in addition to its economic repercussions. and humanitarian, particularly on developing countries in Africa and the Arab world.

Lamamra stressed with his African, European and Arab counterparts the importance of intensifying dialogue and consultations to overcome this situation and achieve security, stability and development.
